pullRequest.body:
After #20066, the fields in 1000.yaml have been documented, but there's still the possibility that changes to those files that break the website won't be noticed until after they've been merged. This PR copies the dataclass constructors which are used in the website script to `scripts/yaml_check.py` so that mathlib4 CI will complain if something is wrong.

I did basically the laziest thing possible here (feed the data into the constructors and then throw away the output) just to get something out the door for discussion; feel free to tell me to refactor this.

I also added documentation of the fields to the top of 100.yaml.

---

cf. https://github.com/leanprover-community/leanprover-community.github.io/pull/561

nodes.body:
### PR summary [32650943c6](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20078/commits/32650943c6eb5c38e9ce324d6af6e4b4300acdc8)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ HundredTheorem:`
`+ ThousandPlusTheorem:`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Thanks for the quick review! I've marked this as `awaiting-author` until @grunweg has had a chance to add info about `doc_decls` (and perhaps any other changes to the docstrings). In the meantime I'll consider adding the `decl` vs `decls` check as well.

I just went ahead and updated this PR for the proposed webpage PR (and also added validation for decl vs decls).

The last commit (a more flexible date format) is in anticipation of https://github.com/1000-plus/1000-plus.github.io/pull/10.
Looks good so far. I need to run now, perhaps I can provide a doc-string for `doc_decls` later.

Actually, one more thought: there are now two locations for these doc comments on the respective fields: once in {100,1000}.yaml, and once in the `HundredTheorems` class.

At the minimum, can we make sure to copy all the doc comments everywhere, and add comments to keep these in sync? In fact, I wonder if it's better to shorten the comment in the yaml file, referring to `yaml_check.py` for a documentation of the respective fields.

(I seemingly cannot edit your PR, so haven't pushed any of these changes directly.)
I wasn't sure what `doc_decls` was for - this needs to be updated before we merge (here and in 1000.yaml as well).
`decl` and `decls` are supposed to be mutually exclusive. You *could* mention this as well. (Or even try to check it, in yaml-check.) The same applies to 1000.yaml.
I just added a check for this. Comments on the code are welcome.
I'll trust you that you copy-pasted correctly; I haven't checked

pullRequest.title: ci: basic check on fields in 100.yaml and 1000.yaml

source.title: remove duplicated field from `ThousandPlusTheorem` dataclass, add comments refering to `scripts/yaml_check.py` in mathlib4

nodes.body: Looks good so far. I need to run now, perhaps I can provide a doc-string for `doc_decls` later.

Thanks for the quick review! I've marked this as `awaiting-author` until @grunweg has had a chance to add info about `doc_decls` (and perhaps any other changes to the docstrings). In the meantime I'll consider adding the `decl` vs `decls` check as well.

Actually, one more thought: there are now two locations for these doc comments on the respective fields: once in {100,1000}.yaml, and once in the `HundredTheorems` class.

At the minimum, can we make sure to copy all the doc comments everywhere, and add comments to keep these in sync? In fact, I wonder if it's better to shorten the comment in the yaml file, referring to `yaml_check.py` for a documentation of the respective fields.

(I seemingly cannot edit your PR, so haven't pushed any of these changes directly.)

I just went ahead and updated this PR for the proposed webpage PR (and also added validation for decl vs decls).

The last commit (a more flexible date format) is in anticipation of https://github.com/1000-plus/1000-plus.github.io/pull/10.
